intro: Stachys aculeolata var. aculeolata, commonly known as the hairy betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite leaves covered in fine hairs. The plant produces spikes of purple or blue flowers in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Its leaves and flowers are used in traditional herbal remedies for their purported calming and medicinal properties.
